PageTitle: authentication-mode (CONSOLE-type user interface view/VTY-type user interface view)
FuncDef:
The authentication-mode command sets the authentication mode for the login to the user interface view.
The undo authentication-mode command restores the default authentication mode. The authentication-mode command sets the authentication mode for the login to the user interface view. The undo authentication-mode command restores the default authentication mode. By default, no authentication mode is set.
ParentView: CONSOLE-type user interface view,VTY-type user interface view

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the password authentication mode for the login to the user interface view.
-

Specifies the AAA authentication mode for the login to the user interface view.
-

ExtraInfo: Authentication modes of user interfaces must be set for logging in to the device.When AAA authentication is applied to a local user, the commands that the local user can use after logging in to the device depends on the level of the local user specified in the AAA configuration.If password authentication is configured, the level of the command that a user can access is determined by the priority of the user interface after the user logs in to the system.
